column2: DELAWARE DMV DRIVING TEST
Question Text
1. Who is most at risk?
column6: Drivers who are driving long distances without rest breaks.

column2: 2. You should use turn signals to indicate your intention with sufficient time to allow other drivers to see the signal:
3. This road sign means:
4. This road sign means:
5. Drivers have to yield to pedestrians:
column4: even if the pedestrian is not obeying traffic controls.
column6: only when the pedestrian is in the crosswalk.
column8: only if the pedestrians have a green light.

column2: 6. When you reach an intersection with stop signs at all four corners, you must yield the right-of-way to the driver:
7. When you change lanes:
column4: look over your shoulder in the direction you plan to move.
column6: look in the left side mirror.

column2: 8. This road sign means:
9. There is no crosswalk and a pedestrian is crossing your lane ahead. You should:
column4: slow down as you pass the pedestrian.
column6: stop and let the pedestrian finish crossing the street.
column8: make eye contact and then pass the pedestrian.

column2: 10. The basic color for traffic control devices used in construction zones is:
11. Which shape is a yield sign?
12. If you see a “lane closed ahead” sign you should:
column4: make a U-turn. You are on the wrong side of the road.
column6: speed to the end of the closed lane and try to get into the other lane.
column8: merge into the correct lane when it is safe.

column2: 13. As you enter a roundabout you should slow down and:
column4: yield to any vehicle coming from your left in the roundabout.
column6: yield to pedestrians and bicyclist crossing before entering the roundabout.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
15. Drivers often fail to see a motorcycle headed toward them. Why?
column4: It is difficult to judge a motorcycle's speed.

column2: 16. A defensive driver:
column4: knows when it is safe to pass other vehicles.
column6: considers what other drivers might do and is always prepared to act.
column8: never drives below the speed limit.

column2: 17. If your car becomes disabled on a highway, you should:
column4: park with all four wheels off the highway, if possible.

column2: 18. This road sign means:
19. This road sign means:
20. This road sign means:
column8: Watch for trucks entering from the side

column2: 21. What is the meaning of orange traffic signs?
column8: Warning of school, pedestrian, and bicycling activity.

column2: 22. The sign in the picture:
column4: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column6: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column8: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 23. A good rule of thumb for drivers sharing the road with a truck is:
column4: it is better to drive to the immediate right of the cab.
column6: always try to stay alongside a truck, but never drive right behind it.
column8: if you can’t see the truck driver in their side mirror, they can’t see you.

column2: 24. When another vehicle is passing you:
column4: pull your vehicle as far to the right as possible without leaving the pavement.
column6: stay in your lane and maintain speed unless there is an emergency.
column8: stay in your lane and reduce speed.

column2: 25. If you get on a wrong expressway exit, you must:
column4: drive in reverse to return to the expressway.
column6: use the the exit ramp to accelerate to expressway speed and blend with traffic.
column8: get off at the next exit and look for signs that tell you how to return to the expressway.

column2: 26. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
27. If cars approaching from opposite directions reach an intersection at the same time:
column4: a car that moves straight must yield to cars that turn left.
column6: a car that turns right must yield to cars that move straight or turn left.
column8: a car that turns left must yield to cars that move straight or turn right.

column2: 28. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 29. You are considered to be driving under the influence when your blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is ____ or more.
30. If another driver is following you too closely on a two-lane road, you should:
column4: try to increase the distance from the car behind.
column6: apply your brakes firmly while turning left.
column8: reduce your speed gradually to encourage the tailgater to pass.
